meanings.definition: A plant structure consisting of a stem with leaves and flowers.
meanings.sent1: The cormus of the rose bush had beautiful red petals.
meanings.sent2: The gardener carefully tended to the cormus of the sunflower.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel played hide-and-seek among the cormus of the bushes.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity bloomed like a vibrant cormus in a garden of ideas.
meanings.sent5: The cormus swayed gracefully in the breeze, a living work of art.

meanings.definition: The main axis of a plant, typically above ground.
meanings.sent1: We studied the cormus of the tree in science class.
meanings.sent2: The cormus of the daisy stood tall in the meadow.
meanings.sent3: The curious rabbit hopped along the cormus, exploring its surroundings.
meanings.sent4: His ambition soared high, like the cormus reaching for the sky.
meanings.sent5: The cormus served as a sturdy foundation for the plant's growth.
